snippet: More than 1,000 gay couples who married after the state’s same-sex marriage ban was overturned could get benefits in days after a favorable ruling on Friday from a federal appeals court.
abstract: More than 1,000 gay couples in Utah who married after state’s same-sex marriage ban was overturned could get benefits in days after a favorable ruling from federal appeals court denying Utah's request to delay benefits indefinitely.
lead_paragraph: More than 1,000 gay couples who married after the state’s same-sex marriage ban was overturned could get benefits in days after a favorable ruling on Friday from a federal appeals court.

headline.main: Utah: Delay on Same-Sex Marriage Benefits is Denied
headline.print_headline: Utah: Delay on Same-Sex Marriage Benefits Is Denied

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
